comment.body:
> Do we want to add Picnic 3 L1 like in [open-quantum-safe/openssl#220](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/pull/220)? Also need to rebase and then unpin from liboqs 0.3.0.

I second that: I'd think missing picnic3 support would also cause the [interop test to keep failing](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/open-quantum-safe/openssl/449/workflows/41731ea0-d31e-4626-9cdb-33de3d81d03c/jobs/2527) even if `BoringSSL` builds OK again

issue.title: Undefined behaviour in SIKE compressed
issue.body:
When enabling clang's UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer using the build sequence
```
mkdir build && cd build
cmake -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER=clang-9 -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug -DUSE_SANITIZER=Undefined -GNinja ..
ninja
```
there are several undefined behaviours identified in the SIKE compressed code.  The log is below:

```
root@8995fd9c66df:~/liboqs/build# tests/test_kem SIKE-p434-compressed
Configuration info
==================
Target platform:  x86_64-Linux-4.19.76-linuxkit
Compiler:         clang (9.0.0 (tags/RELEASE_900/final))
OQS version:      0.2.1-dev
Git commit:       b3ca583e00ceafc800cf0c1f75d4965bdc627b22
OpenSSL enabled:  Yes (OpenSSL 1.1.1  11 Sep 2018)
AES:              OpenSSL
SHA-2:            OpenSSL
SHA-3:            OpenSSL
CFLAGS:            -fvisibility=hidden -Werror -Wall -Wextra -Wpedantic -Wimplicit -Wunused -Wcomment -Wchar-subscripts -Wuninitialized -Wstrict-prototypes -Wshadow -Wformat-security -Wwrite-strings -ggdb3 -fcolor-diagnostics -Wno-missing-braces

================================================================================
Sample computation for KEM SIKE-p434-compressed
================================================================================
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:108:35: runtime error: index 4 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:96:39: runtime error: index 330 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:98:39: runtime error: index 330 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:115:35: runtime error: index 4 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:65:34: runtime error: index 4 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
../src/kem/sike/P434/../compression/dlog.c:58:38: runtime error: index 8 out of bounds for type 'const f2elm_t' (aka 'felm_t const[2]')
shared secrets are equal
```

comment.body:
> > These still happen:
> 
> Only for `SIKE-p434-compressed`, or for the other parameters as well?

For the others as well, though I didn't copy the output.

We also need to add the new picnicl1full param set, and use it as picnic default (instead of picnicl1fs). I did that on OpenSSL's [PR 224](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/pull/224). Would you like to add this change to this PR, or merge this one first and then I can create a new one.

> We also need to add the new picnicl1full param set, and use it as picnic default (instead of picnicl1fs). I did that on OpenSSL's [PR 224](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/pull/224). Would you like to add this change to this PR, or merge this one first and then I can create a new one.

I'll merge this one in since the interoperability tests are currently failing, and I can open another one to track the OpenSSL PR (and we should merge both in at the same time to avoid nightly build failures).

> I'll merge this one in since the interoperability tests are currently failing, and I can open another one to track the OpenSSL PR (and we should merge both in at the same time to avoid nightly build failures).

Ok. I'll create another PR to deal with this, we can merge both tomorrow at the same time.

issue.title: Re-add AES-NI with CPU feature detection

comment.body:
@xvzcf @christianpaquin Can either of you help me understand the failure on Windows? It says that `oqs_aes128_load_schedule_ni` is undefined at link time.

As far as I can tell all calls to `oqs_aes128_load_schedule_ni` are wrapped inside an `#if defined(OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS)`.  So for this error to occur, the compiler on Windows must think that OQS\_USE\_CPU\_EXTENSIONS is true.

The file that provides `oqs_aes128_load_schedule_ni` is in a CMakeLists.txt surrounded by `if (OQS_USE_AES_INSTRUCTIONS)`.  

So I'm left to conclude that `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS` and `OQS_USE_AES_INSTRUCTIONS` might be set inconsistently on Windows?

Remind me: are we intending for Windows to use optimized instructions?

issue.title: Re-add AES-NI with CPU feature detection

comment.body:
Both `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS` and `OQS_PORTABLE_BUILD` are `ON` by default. `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS` should only have effect, however, when the compiler is GCC or Clang. 

That means MSVC definitely can't use optimized instructions. What's probably happening is that `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS`, being `ON`, causes the corresponding macro to be defined in the C code, which then leads to the AES-NI functions being mentioned in `aes/aes.c`, which ultimately causes the MSVC build to fail with link errors (because `aes128_ni.c` and `aes128_ni.c` are only included when `OQS_USE_AES_INSTRUCTIONS` is defined, which is only possible if `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS` is defined and the compiler is GCC/Clang and the `__AES__` macro is defined)

From a cursory glance, the msys2 build seems to fail because AES instructions are supported but `#pragma unroll` isn't.

issue.title: Re-add AES-NI with CPU feature detection

comment.body: I'll think about fixes, one is that perhaps `OQS_USE_CPU_EXTENSIONS` should be set more carefully than [this](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt#L39).
